title: Boku no Hero Academia the Movie 3: World Heroes' Mission - Tabidachi
content:
I never understood why stuff like this isn't included in the movie, it's just divisive and makes it hard to access the entirety of the series.
That out of the way. This was actually fun to see.

I liked the casual humorous vibes, it went so well with what you'd expect from a My Hero Academia episode, unlike the disappointment that was the parent movie. I sort of liked the bold lines on the art, making it closer to a comic than the movie which is always a welcomed change of pace.

I always liked the dynamic between the Endeavor and Hawks duo, both are monsters in theirown right, but not equally as monstrous on the public eye.
